data.name: index_eempty
data.value: The primary configuration file for BIND $1 does not exist, or is not valid. Create it?

data.name: index_local
data.value: Setup nameserver for internal non-internet use only

data.name: index_download
data.value: Setup as an internet name server, and download root server information

data.name: index_webmin
data.value: Setup as an internet name server, but use Webmin's older root server information

data.name: index_create
data.value: Create Primary Configuration File and Start Nameserver

data.name: index_none
data.value: There are no DNS zones defined for this name server

data.name: index_applymsg
data.value: Click this button to restart the running BIND server. This will cause the current configuration to become active

data.name: master_freezemsg2
data.value: Click this button to freeze a dynamic zone before updating it.

data.name: master_unfreezemsg2
data.value: Click this button to unfreeze a dynamic zone after having updated it.

data.name: master_checkzonemsg
data.value: Click this button to have BIND check the records in this zone, and report on any problems.

data.name: index_applymsg2
data.value: Click this button to restart the running BIND server and all cluster slaves. This will cause the current configuration to become active.

data.name: index_startmsg
data.value: Click this button to start the BIND server, and load the current configuration.

data.name: index_stopmsg
data.value: Click this button to stop the BIND server. Any clients using it will be unable to resolve hostnames until it is restarted.

data.name: index_toomany
data.value: There are too many zones on your system to display here.

data.name: index_viewwarn
data.value: Warning - the following zones are not in any view : $1

data.name: index_viewwarn2
data.value: BIND may not be able to start until they are moved to a view.

data.name: index_vnone
data.value: There are no client views defined on this server.

data.name: index_sapplymsg
data.value: Click this button to restart the running BIND server on the selected host. This will cause any slave zones that you have created on the server to become active.

data.name: index_ewrongchroot
data.value: Warning : The chroot directory $2 that Webmin thinks BIND is using may be incorrect. The zone files for $1 domains could not be found.

data.name: index_emissingchroot
data.value: Warning : Webmin thinks that BIND is not using a chroot directory, but that may be incorrect. The zone files for $1 domains could not be found.

data.name: index_eexpired
data.value: Warning : The following zones have expired DNSSEC signatures : $1

data.name: index_eexpired_conf
data.value: Automatic signing should be re-enabled on the $1 page.

data.name: index_eexpired_mod
data.value: Use the $1 module to either disable DNSSEC for these domains, or check why signing is failing.

data.name: hint_desc
data.value: The root zone is used by your DNS server to contact the root servers on the internet, so that it can resolve names in domains not handled by your DNS server, like <tt>.com</tt> or <tt>.net.au</tt>. Unless your DNS server is for use on an internal network or you are forwarding all queries to another server, you should not delete this root zone.

data.name: hint_ecannot
data.value: You are not allowed to edit this root zone

data.name: hint_refetchdesc
data.value: Click this button to have Webmin re-download the root zone file from it's source on the Internic FTP server.

data.name: hint_deletedesc
data.value: Click this button to remove this root zone. Without it, your nameserver will be unable to resolve domains on the Internet other than those it is a secondary for.

data.name: hcreate_desc
data.value: The root zone is used by your DNS server to contact the root servers on the internet, so that it can resolve names in domains not handled by your DNS server, like <tt>.com</tt> or <tt>.net.au</tt>. If you are using multiple views, you may need to have a separate root zone in each view so that all clients can resolve internet domains properly.

data.name: hcreate_webmin
data.value: Use Webmin's older root server information

data.name: hcreate_ecannot
data.value: You are not allowed to create root zones

data.name: vdelete_mesg2
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete the client view $1 ?

data.name: gen_desc
data.value: This page allows you to define generators, each of which will create multiple records in this zone using an incrementing counter. This can be useful for delegating parts of the reverse zone to another server.

data.name: add_createerr

data.name: add_egname
data.value: An NS record name cannot be specified when adding a group

data.name: add_emyip
data.value: Could not work out this system's IP address. You should set the Default master server IP for remote slave zones on the Module Config page.

data.name: mass_desc
data.value:
This page allows you to create multiple zones at once from an uploaded or server-side text file. Each line in the file must have the following format:

domainname:type:filename:master IPs

The type must be one of master, slave, stub or forward. The filename is optional, and will be computed automatically if missing. The master IPs only need to be given for slave zones.

data.name: mass_onslave
data.value: Create master zones on slave servers?

data.name: mass_err
data.value: Failed to create zones from batch file

data.name: mass_elocalcannot
data.value: You are not allowed to use the selected batch file

data.name: mass_eonslave
data.value: Errors occurred created on slave servers : $1

data.name: mass_eviewcannot
data.value: You are not allowed to add zones to this view

data.name: massdelete_rusure
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete the $1 selected zones? ($2)

data.name: massdelete_vwarn
data.value: Some zones are associated with the Virtualmin domain $1, and so should not be deleted here!

data.name: massdelete_vwarn2
data.value: Some zones are associated with the Virtualmin domain $1 and $2 others, and so should not be deleted here!

data.name: rndc_desc
data.value: This page can be used to setup BIND for control by the RNDC program, so that individual zones can be refreshed without needing to do a full BIND restart.

data.name: rndc_desc2
data.value: RNDC appears to be setup properly already, so you probably do not need to use this form.

data.name: rndc_rusure
data.value: Are you sure you want to over-write the RNDC configuration file $1, and enable control by RNDC in your BIND configuration?

data.name: rndc_rusure2
data.value: Are you sure you want to create the RNDC configuration file $1, and enable control by RNDC in your BIND configuration?

data.name: rndc_ekey

data.name: rndc_esecret

data.name: dnssec_ecannot
data.value: You are not allowed to configure DNSSEC

data.name: dnssec_desc
data.value: Zones signed with DNSSEC typically have two keys - a zone key which must be re-generated and signed regularly, and a key signing key which remains constant. This page allows you to configure Webmin to perform this re-signing automatically.

data.name: dnssec_err
data.value: Failed to save DNSSEC key re-signing

data.name: dnssec_eperiod
data.value: Missing or invalid number of days between re-signs

data.name: dt_zone_already
data.value: The zone appears to be signed, but is not using DNSSEC-Tools.

data.name: dt_zone_desc
data.value: This zone does not have DNSSEC enabled yet. You can use this form to have Webmin automate DNSSEC processing using DNSSEC-Tools, so that clients resolving this zone are protected against DNS spoofing attacks.

data.name: dt_zone_disabledesc
data.value: Removes this zone from the list of zones managed by DNSSEC-Tools for zone signing and key rollover.

data.name: dt_zone_errfopen
data.value: Could not open the system rollrec file for writing

data.name: dt_zone_enocmd
data.value: dnssec-tools not installed, or command not found

data.name: dt_zone_erollctl
data.value: Could not notify the rollover manager of rollover event

data.name: dt_zone_deleting_state
data.value: Deleting all state associated with zone $1 ...

data.name: dt_zone_expandsep
data.value: Show current KSK and DS set details ..

data.name: dt_zone_resigndesc
data.value: Use existing keys to resign the zone data immediately

data.name: dt_zone_zskrolldesc
data.value: Force rollover of the zone's zone signing key

data.name: dt_zone_kskrolldesc
data.value: Force rollover of the zone's key signing key

data.name: dt_zone_ksknotifydesc
data.value: Resume KSK rollover. Operator must confirm that the new DS set for the zone's KSKs has been published in the parent zone

data.name: dt_zone_migratedesc
data.value: Import existing set of keys to DNSSEC-Tools and have DNSSEC-Tools automate future DNSSEC key rollover operations.

data.name: dt_zone_createkrf
data.value: Creating keyrec file for zone $1 and moving keys for zone to DNSSEC-Tools managed location ...

data.name: dt_zone_enokey
data.value: Could not find all required keys for zone $1

data.name: dt_conf_ecannot
data.value: You are not allowed to configure DNSSEC

data.name: dt_conf_desc
data.value: This page allows you to configure the DNSSEC parameters for zones that have DNSSEC enabled.

data.name: dt_conf_eendtime
data.value: Missing or invalid signature validity period

data.name: dt_conf_eksklife
data.value: Missing or invalid KSK rollover interval

data.name: dt_conf_ezsklife
data.value: Missing or invalid ZSK rollover interval

data.name: zonekey_desc
data.value: This zone does not have a DNSSEC signing key yet. You can use this form to have Webmin create one, so that clients resolving this zone are protected against DNS spoofing attacks.

data.name: zonekey_esize
data.value: Key size must be a number of bits between $1 and $2

data.name: zonekey_already
data.value: The zone already has a DNSSEC key, and so is already signed.

data.name: zonekey_webmin
data.value: Webmin will re-sign the zone automatically when any changes are made.

data.name: zonekey_expandksk
data.value: Show public and private key-signing-key details ..

data.name: zonekey_expandzone
data.value: Show public and private zone-key details ..

data.name: zonekey_noprivate
data.value: However, Webmin could not find the private key associated with the zone, and so will not be able to re-sign it.

data.name: zonekey_eprivate
data.value: The private key associated with this zone could not be read : $1

data.name: zonekey_disabledesc
data.value: Removes the DNSSEC key from this zone, and all signing records. Once this is done, you will be able to generate a new key.

data.name: zonekey_signdesc
data.value: Immediately re-sign this zone, so that any changes to records made manually will be included in the signing records.

data.name: zonekey_resigndesc
data.value: Generate a new zone signing key, sign it with the zone's master key, and re-sign all records.

data.name: sign_emsg
data.value: DNSSEC signing after records change failed : $1

data.name: trusted_ealg
data.value: Missing or invalid algorithm number in row $1

data.name: trusted_ekey

data.name: trusted_setup
data.value: For DNSSEC to be useful to verify the majority of signed zones on the Internet, BIND must be configured to use a DLV server. Webmin can set this up for you, using the ICS DLV server at $1.

data.name: trusted_ok
data.value: Setup DLV and Enable DNSSEC Verification

data.name: xfer_doing
data.value: Testing transfer of slave zone from $1 ..

data.name: xfer_count
data.value: Test transfer successfully fetched $1 records from at least one nameserver. Actual transfers by BIND should also succeed.

data.name: xfer_none
